title: Atlanta chefs pose in nothing but aprons for calendar
title_page: Atlanta chefs pose in nothing but aprons for calendar
text:
If you've always wanted to see your favorite chef in next-to-nothing, now's your chance. As part of a 2016 calendar, several Atlanta-area chefs posed wearing nothing but Hedley and Bennett aprons with the farmers who grow their food. Proceeds from the calendar, available for $20 at the Peachtree Road Farmer's Market , will benefit The Farmer Fund, an Atlanta nonprofit founded to serve Metro Atlanta farmers in the face of natural disaster.
Notables include Steven Satterfield of Miller Union , who graces the cover with Darby Smith of Sun Dog Farmer , plus an adorable goat; Zeb Stevenson of Watershed , who poses with Paula Guilbeau of Heirloom Gardens ; and Todd Ginsberg of The General Muir , who poses with Chris Edwards of Mayflor Farms .
